heading: 1 Geographic data in R
text:
Use summary() geometry column world data object. output tell us :
geometry type?
number countries?
coordinate reference system (CRS)?
geometry type?number countries?coordinate reference system (CRS)?Run code ‘generated’ map world Figure ?? end Section ??.
Find two similarities two differences image computer book.
cex argument (see ?plot)?
cex set sqrt(world$pop) / 10000?
Bonus: experiment different ways visualize global population.
cex argument (see ?plot)?cex set sqrt(world$pop) / 10000?Bonus: experiment different ways visualize global population.Use plot() create maps Nigeria context (see Section ??).
Adjust lwd, col expandBB arguments plot().
Challenge: read documentation text() annotate map.
Adjust lwd, col expandBB arguments plot().Challenge: read documentation text() annotate map.Create empty RasterLayer object called my_raster 10 columns 10 rows.
Assign random values 0 10 new raster plot .Read-raster/nlcd.tif file spDataLarge package.
kind information can get properties file?
code:
#> terra version 1.4.2
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'terra'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:knitr':
#> 
#>     spin
library(terra)
nlcd = rast(system.file("raster/nlcd.tif", package = "spDataLarge"))
dim(nlcd)
#> [1] 1359 1073    1
res(nlcd)
#> [1] 31.5 31.5
ext(nlcd)
#> SpatExtent : 301903.344386758, 335735.354381954, 4111244.46098842, 4154086.47216415 (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
crs(nlcd)
#> [1] "PROJCRS["NAD83 / UTM zone 12N",
    BASEGEOGCRS["NAD83",
        DATUM["North American Datum 1983",
            ELLIPSOID["GRS 1980",6378137,298.257222101,
                LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]]],
        PRIMEM["Greenwich",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433]],
        ID["EPSG",4269]],
    CONVERSION["UTM zone 12N",
        METHOD["Transverse Mercator",
            ID["EPSG",9807]],
        PARAMETER["Latitude of natural origin",0,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8801]],
        PARAMETER["Longitude of natural origin",-111,
            ANGLEUNIT["degree",0.0174532925199433],
            ID["EPSG",8802]],
        PARAMETER["Scale factor at natural origin",0.9996,
            SCALEUNIT["unity",1],
            ID["EPSG",8805]],
        PARAMETER["False easting",500000,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8806]],
        PARAMETER["False northing",0,
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1],
            ID["EPSG",8807]]],
    CS[Cartesian,2],
        AXIS["(E)",east,
            ORDER[1],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
        AXIS["(N)",north,
            ORDER[2],
            LENGTHUNIT["metre",1]],
    USAGE[
        SCOPE["Engineering survey, topographic mapping."],
        AREA["North America - between 114°W and 108°W - onshore and offshore. Canada - Alberta; Northwest Territories; Nunavut; Saskatchewan.  United States (USA) - Arizona; Colorado; Idaho; Montana; New Mexico; Utah; Wyoming."],
        BBOX[31.33,-114,84,-108]],
    ID["EPSG",26912]]"
